questions.neutral: You look like you've seen some things - rough day?

hobby.message: Urban exploration or just drinking underground?

wrong_hobby_answer: That's not me - In free time, I explore the city's underground. It's a different world down there.
neutral_answer: Just doing what needs to be done, you know.
Saw some commotion today, lots of noise downtown.
While exploring those underground tunnels, things got loud.
The city’s always buzzing with something.
A man just has to stay alert.
Rough? Just a bit tangled up in things, as usual.
Got caught in the rumble downtown earlier, protests over some tech trouble.
Underground can't shield you from noise when it's this loud above.
Been poking around those old tunnels, it's a calming hobby of mine.
You pick up on a lot you don't expect from down there.
Takes a bit to unwind after all that racket.
Always something happening lately, isn't it?
Seen a few things, sure, but you get used to it.
Hobby of mine takes me below ground, into forgotten tunnels.
Protests got quite loud today over those hospital glitches.
Nice and quiet down there, usually — except when the city's roaring above.
I like the old parts, the echoes tell you stories if you listen.
Kind of hard to relax with all that uproar, though.
The city seems more unsettled than usual.
Oh, I've seen a bit, true enough. Busy day in the city.
You know my thing? Exploring the underground tunnels — it's the quiet spots I love.
Today wasn't so quiet, with all those protests over BCI issues.
The hospital's problems have stirred the city up, heard the wildest echoes from the vents.
It's quite something, being below and feeling the pulse of the chaos above.
There's a strange peace down there, even with the noise — like a secret world.
Today, though, even my quiet spots were vibrating with it all.
Rough might be an understatement!
I've got this thing for exploring Stenograd's old utility tunnels — a bit of an urban explorer by heart.
Protests about the BCI kicking up a storm above, louder than you'd think underground!
Those hospital glitches have everyone riled up — echoes everything down below.
It's the city's underbelly I love, where stories of systems gone awry linger.
Crazy how you can feel the city's tension ripple through concrete.
The tunnels offer a place untouched by oversight, but not today. Felt it all.
hobby_answer: You still remember that, huh? Just down there for fresh air, nothing more.
The tunnels? Yeah, I peek in now and then, keeps things interesting.
Not much happening underground now—too much noise above, you get it.
The usual. Some spots are less... private these days, you know?
Rumors of trouble up top keep people on edge down below.
Urban exploring, kind of. Finding quiet spots, avoiding crowds.
Protests drove me out of my favorite tunnel last week. Too noisy.
Lately, even the tunnels aren't spared from the chaos above.
More folks seem curious about old spaces now; not ideal for me.
Got a few new places to explore since things got intense topside.
A bit of both, really. Kind of hard to sip when the city's so loud everywhere.
Found a hidden corner 'til protests clued the world in.
Used to be peaceful—now, you hear the commotion above even down there.
Guess the hospital uproar made my spots less secretive.
Still, I manage a quiet sip beneath the chaos now and again.
Drinking underground's the charm. Tunnels were my peace... until last week.
Those hospital protests? Made my escape routes noisy, compromised the quiet.
Both, really. More for the solitude, but last week tested that.
Funny thing happened—the tunnels near the hospital were noisier than usual.
Was sipping and reflecting when the roof started speaking with protestors' echoes.
Met someone unexpected there, hidden beneath the BCI faults and chaos.
Ran into an old friend, reminded me how tangled life can be beneath the surface.
Ever explore and feel the distant world pressing down? Last week was a bit of that.
The old tunnels used to be my escape; now they're a part of the city's pulse.
